isis.stitle: EC-30 ABS / ATC CONTROLLER - ABS PARTIAL SHUTDOWN

svcprocinfo.para: Depending which component the fault is detected on, the ABS and ATC functions may be fully or partially disabled. Even with the ABS warning lamp on, the EC-30 may still provide ABS function on wheels that are not affected by the fault. The EC-30 should be serviced as soon as possible.

svcsubproc.title: Front ABS Modulator Fault
svcsubproc.para: ABS on the affected wheel is disabled. ABS and ATC on all other wheels remains active.

svcsubproc.title: Rear ABS Modulator Fault
svcsubproc.para: ATC is disabled. ABS on the affected wheel is disabled. ABS on all other wheels remains active.

svcsubproc.title: Front Wheel Speed Sensor Fault
svcsubproc.para: The faulted wheel is still controlled by using input from the remaining wheel speed sensor on the front axle. ABS remains active on the rear wheels. ATC is disabled.

svcsubproc.title: Mid or Rear Wheel Speed Sensor Fault
svcsubproc.para: ATC is disabled. In a four sensor system, ABS on the affected wheel is disabled, but ABS on all other wheels remains active.
In a six sensor system, ABS remains active by using input from the remaining rear wheel speed sensor on the same side.

svcsubproc.title: ATC Modulator Fault
svcsubproc.para: ATC is disabled. ABS remains active.

svcsubproc.title: J1939/J1922 Communication Fault
svcsubproc.para: ATC is disabled. ABS remains active.

svcsubproc.title: ECU Fault
svcsubproc.para: ABS and ATC are disabled. The system reverts to normal braking.

svcsubproc.title: Voltage Fault
svcsubproc.para: While voltage is out of range, ABS and ATC are disabled. The system reverts to normal braking. When the correct voltage level is restored, full ABS and ATC function is available. Operating voltage range is 9.0 to 16.0 VDC.
